title: Part a. [0–6]
stimulusHtml:
6 points

The average acceleration is the change in velocity divided by the time interval

1 point: For correct subtraction to find the time interval
Δt = tƒ −ti = 0.37 − 0.33 = 0.04 s

From graph: vi = 0.22 m s

1 point: For getting vi in the range 0.2 < vi ≤ 0.25 m/s

From graph: vƒ = −0.18 m/s

1 point: For getting vƒ in the range −0.15 ≥ vƒ > −0.20 m/s

1 point: For getting Δv consistent with the student's values of vi and vƒ, including subtracting in the correct direction

Δv =vƒ −vi = −0.18 m/s − 0.22 m/s = −0.40 m/s

title: Part b. [0–3]
stimulusHtml:
3 points (2 points if Method 3)

Note: There were three alternate methods for solving parts b. and c. that could receive full credit.

Method 1

1 point: For any indication of the concept of finding the area under the curve in the second graph
